en: Baby is sleeping. Don't be so loud.
zh: 宝宝在睡觉，别那么大声。

en: The children are sleeping. Please don't be so noisy.
zh: 孩子们在睡觉，请不要这么吵闹。

en: Sister cities are the same as good neighbors.
zh: 姐妹城市就像好邻居一样。

en: The sisters dueled with each other verbally.
zh: 姐妹俩互相用言语争吵。

en: Both my sister and brother go to college.
zh: 我的姐姐和弟弟都在上大学。

en: My sister is having a baby in June.
zh: 我姐姐六月份要生孩子了。

en: My sister washes her shoes every Sunday.
zh: 我姐姐每个星期天都洗鞋子。

en: My sister is subject to colds.
zh: 我姐姐容易感冒。

en: My sister was a beautiful woman.
zh: 我姐姐曾经是个漂亮的女人。

en: My sister works in a bank as a secretary.
zh: 我姐姐在银行当秘书。

en: My sister fixed me with an angry stare.
zh: 我姐姐生气地瞪了我一眼。

en: My sister has made remarkable progress in English.
zh: 我姐姐的英语取得了显著的进步。

en: My sister works as an assistant to a college professor.
zh: 我姐姐在大学里当教授的助手。

en: My sister is cooking in the kitchen.
zh: 我姐姐正在厨房做饭。

en: My sister has made up her mind to be a teacher.
zh: 我姐姐已经决定当一名老师。

en: My sister is playing with dolls.
zh: 我姐姐在玩洋娃娃。

en: My sister spends too much time dressing.
zh: 我姐姐花太多时间打扮了。

en: My sister cheers young sumo wrestlers.
zh: 我姐姐为年轻的相扑选手加油。

en: My sister presses my trousers.
zh: 我姐姐帮我熨裤子。

en: My sister asked me to lend her the dictionary.
zh: 我姐姐让我把字典借给她。

en: My sister cooks us delicious dishes.
zh: 我姐姐给我们做美味的菜肴。

en: My sister married Mr Sato, whose father is my mother's friend.
zh: 我姐姐嫁给了佐藤先生，他的父亲是我妈妈的朋友。

en: My sister, wearing her favorite red coat, went out today.
zh: 我姐姐今天穿着她最喜欢的红色外套出去了。

en: My sister dressed herself for the party in a hurry.
zh: 我妹妹匆匆忙忙地打扮好去参加聚会。

en: My sister says that she wants to study abroad after leaving.
zh: 我妹妹说她毕业后想出国留学。

en: My sister is engaged in social work.
zh: 我妹妹从事社会工作。

en: My sister married him in spite of our objections.
zh: 我妹妹不顾我们的反对嫁给了他。

en: My sister is always weighing herself.
zh: 我妹妹总是称体重。

en: My sister works at the United States Embassy in London.
zh: 我妹妹在伦敦的美国大使馆工作。

en: My sister is thin, but I'm a little overweight.
zh: 我妹妹很瘦，但我有点超重。

en: My sister sang an English song at the party.
zh: 我妹妹在聚会上唱了一首英文歌。

en: My sister is crazy about tennis.
zh: 我妹妹对网球很着迷。

en: My sister can swim very fast.
zh: 我妹妹游泳游得很快。

en: My sister is a good typist.
zh: 我妹妹打字很快。

en: My older sister is good at typing.
zh: 我姐姐很擅长打字。

en: My sister has a nice piano.
zh: 我妹妹有一架不错的钢琴。

en: My older sister plays the guitar well.
zh: 我姐姐吉他弹得很好。

en: My sister was on a diet for a week, but gave up.
zh: 我妹妹节食了一个星期，但放弃了。

en: My sister's work is teaching English.
zh: 我妹妹的工作是教英语。

en: I'm headed for my sister's wedding.
zh: 我要去参加我妹妹的婚礼。

en: I thought about going to my sister's.
zh: 我考虑过要去我妹妹家。

en: My sister Susan gets up early every morning.
zh: 我妹妹苏珊每天早上都起得很早。

en: My sister and I are different in every way.
zh: 我和我妹妹在各方面都不同。

en: Unlike her sister, Hanako is indifferent to her dress.
zh: 和她姐姐不同，花子对自己的穿着漠不关心。

en: Follow the example of your sister.
zh: 以你妹妹为榜样。

en: Follow your sister's example.
zh: 以你妹妹为榜样。

en: Your sister didn't hurt herself, did she?
zh: 你妹妹没有受伤吧？

en: Compared with her sister, she isn't very punctual.
zh: 和她姐姐相比，她不是很守时。

en: My sister showed me a new watch.
zh: 我妹妹给我看了一块新手表。

en: My sister showed a new watch to me.
zh: 我妹妹给我展示了一块新手表。

en: My sister sometimes makes our dinner.
zh: 我妹妹有时会做我们的晚餐。

en: My sister made me a beautiful doll.
zh: 我妹妹给我做了一个漂亮的娃娃。

en: It began to rain, but we walked on.
zh: 开始下雨了，但我们继续走了。

en: It is Soseki that my sister likes best.
zh: 我妹妹最喜欢漱石。

en: I got up early to catch the first train.
zh: 我早起赶第一班火车。

en: She left home early in the morning for fear that she might miss the first train.
zh: 她一大早就离开了家，生怕赶不上第一班火车。

en: I got up earlier than usual so that I might catch the first train.
zh: 我比平时起得早，以便赶上第一班火车。

en: I got up earlier than usual in order to catch the first train.
zh: 我比平时起得早，为了赶上第一班火车。

en: I got up earlier than usual to get the first train.
zh: 我比平时起得早去赶第一班火车。

en: I got up earlier than usual to catch the first train.
zh: 我比平时起得早，为了赶上第一班火车。

en: The first bus will leave 10 minutes behind time.
zh: 第一班公共汽车将晚点10分钟发车。

en: The driver said that the first bus starts at 6:00 a.m.
zh: 司机说第一班公共汽车早上6点发车。

en: I had breakfast in haste in order to be in time for the first bus.
zh: 我匆匆忙忙地吃了早餐，以便赶上第一班公共汽车。

en: I ate breakfast quickly so I would be in time for the first bus.
zh: 我很快地吃了早餐，这样我才能赶上第一班公共汽车。

en: Plan your work before you start it.
zh: 在开始工作之前，先计划好你的工作。

en: A good beginning makes a good ending.
zh: 好的开始是成功的一半。

en: I thought it easy at first.
zh: 我起初认为这很容易。

en: Whatever has a beginning also has an end.
zh: 凡事有始必有终。

en: When I first got to New York, I was in a daze.
zh: 当我刚到纽约时，我感到茫然。

en: At first each man had paid $10.
zh: 起初，每个人都支付了10美元。

en: I knew it all along.
zh: 我一直都知道。

en: Jiro was all smiles after he made a bundle at the pachinko parlor.
zh: 次郎在弹珠店大赚一笔后，一直笑逐颜开。

en: The quarterly growth of 1.2% means an annual growth rate of 4.8%.
zh: 季度增长1.2%意味着年增长率为4.8%。

en: A quarterly growth of 1.2% means an annual growth rate of 4.8%.
zh: 季度增长1.2%意味着年度增长率为4.8%。

en: You get off at Yotuya Station.
zh: 你在四谷站下车。

en: Four armed men held up the bank and escaped with $4 million.
zh: 四名武装人员抢劫了银行，带着400万美元逃脱了。

en: They say one's forties are a dangerous time of life.
zh: 人们说四十岁是人生的危险时期。

en: At forty, he does not get as angry as he used to.
zh: 四十岁时，他不像以前那么容易生气了。

en: I have been walking for over four hours.
zh: 我已经走了四个多小时了。

en: I've been walking for over four hours.
zh: 我已经走了四个多小时了。

en: I asked Mother to wake me up at four.
zh: 我让妈妈四点叫醒我。

en: Shikoku was hit by Typhoon No. 10.
zh: 四国遭受了第10号台风的袭击。

en: It's April first.
zh: 今天是四月一日。

en: The new term starts in April.
zh: 新学期四月开始。

en: The changing seasons in Japan do much to Japan's agriculture.
zh: 日本四季的变化对日本的农业影响很大。

en: It is fall that I like best of all the seasons.
zh: 在所有季节中，我最喜欢秋天。

en: Spring is my favourite of the four seasons.
zh: 春天是我最喜欢的四个季节之一。

en: The opposite sides of a rectangle are parallel.
zh: 长方形的对边是平行的。

en: Have you ever found a four-leaf clover?
zh: 你有没有找到过四叶草？

en: You can slip through the fence on all fours.
zh: 你可以手脚并用地从栅栏下钻过去。

en: History is not his major subject.
zh: 历史不是他的主修科目。

en: The commander gave orders that his men fire at once.
zh: 指挥官下令他的士兵立即开火。

en: The librarian classified the books according to subject.
zh: 图书馆员根据主题对书籍进行分类。

en: The priest pronounced them man and wife.
zh: 牧师宣布他们成为夫妻。

en: The priest blessed the newly built church.
zh: 牧师祝福了新建的教堂。

en: The priest blessed the marriage of the happy couple.
zh: 牧师祝福了这对幸福夫妇的婚姻。

en: The priest blessed the congregation.
zh: 牧师祝福了会众。

en: The priest blessed us.
zh: 牧师祝福了我们。

en: The priest blessed the congregation at the end of the mass.
zh: 弥撒结束时，牧师祝福了会众。

en: The priest blessed the marriage of the two.
zh: 牧师为两人的婚姻祈福。

en: The bishops were in favor of the proposition.
zh: 主教们赞成这项提议。

en: The bishop felt pity for the immigrants who were abandoned, and gave them help.
zh: 主教对被遗弃的移民感到怜悯，并给予他们帮助。

en: It made me nervous when I was asked by the host to offer some words of congratulation.
zh: 当主持人要求我说几句祝贺的话时，我感到很紧张。

en: It is an exciting city, New York.
zh: 纽约是一个令人兴奋的城市。

en: A stimulating new book attracts attention.
zh: 一本引人入胜的新书引起了人们的注意。

en: You don't like sashimi, do you?
zh: 你不喜欢生鱼片，是吗？

en: The puncture wound was very deep and had to be examined for infection.
zh: 刺伤很深，必须检查是否感染。

en: Shake the medicine bottle before use.
zh: 使用前摇晃药瓶。

en: I'll send my man to you with the letter.
zh: 我会派人把信送给你。

en: The butler announced Mr. and Mrs. Smith.
zh: 管家宣布史密斯先生和夫人到。

en: Shake the bottle before using.
zh: 使用前摇晃瓶子。

en: The mission took the direct route by air to the boundary.
zh: 特派团乘飞机走直线到达边界。

en: The messenger left for London in secret.
zh: 信使秘密前往伦敦。

en: We look at the expressions they use.
zh: 我们看看他们使用的表达方式。

en: Iron not used soon rusts.
zh: 铁不用很快就会生锈。

en: Do you have an extra shelf I can use?
zh: 你有多余的架子给我用吗？

en: The campers were hard up for water because their well had run dry.
zh: 露营者们因为他们的井干涸了而缺水。

en: Keep a record of how much you spend.
zh: 记录下你花了多少钱。

en: It's better to carry plastic chopsticks and wash them than to use disposable chopsticks to throw away.
zh: 与其使用一次性筷子扔掉，不如携带塑料筷子清洗后使用。

en: Instead of using disposable chopsticks, it's better to use plastic chopsticks that you can wash.
zh: 与其使用一次性筷子，不如使用可以清洗的塑料筷子。

en: It's better to use plastic chopsticks and wash them than to use disposable chopsticks.
zh: 与其使用一次性筷子，不如使用塑料筷子清洗后使用。

en: Don't delay on this errand.
zh: 不要耽误这件事。

en: You can use my car, if you want to.
zh: 如果你想，你可以用我的车。

en: You may use my typewriter if you want to.
zh: 如果你想用，你可以用我的打字机。

en: Take care not to strain your eyes.
zh: 注意不要用眼过度。

en: The tailor makes the man.
zh: 人靠衣装。

en: Specifications and price are subject to change.
zh: 规格和价格如有更改，恕不另行通知。

en: That couldn't be helped.
zh: 那也没办法。

en: It couldn't be helped.
zh: 那也没办法。

en: There is no choice.
zh: 别无选择。

en: It can't be helped. Let's make the best of the bad job.
zh: 没办法了。让我们在不利的局面下尽力而为吧。

en: I add a few finishing touches.
zh: 我再做一些最后的润色。

en: Apply two coats of the paint for a good finish.
zh: 为了获得良好的效果，请涂两层油漆。

en: Just finished it.
zh: 刚完成。

en: I don't like running down members of the staff, but he's the rudest man I've met.
zh: 我不喜欢说员工的坏话，但他是我见过的最粗鲁的人。

en: Workaholics view holidays as a waste of time.
zh: 工作狂认为假期是浪费时间。

en: A person who is addicted to work is called a workaholic.
zh: 沉迷于工作的人被称为工作狂。

en: You must not smoke while working.
zh: 工作时禁止吸烟。

en: Must I wear a tie at work?
zh: 我上班必须打领带吗？

en: Do I have to wear a tie at work?
zh: 我上班需要打领带吗？

en: Stop reading comic books while working.
zh: 工作时不要看漫画书。

en: Please do not use the phone while working.
zh: 工作时请勿使用电话。

en: Office managers expect accuracy, efficiency, and dedication.
zh: 办公室经理期望准确、高效和敬业。

en: We have equipped our office with computers.
zh: 我们为办公室配备了电脑。

en: My business acquaintances know this number.
zh: 我的生意上的熟人都知道这个号码。

en: Your family should come before your career.
zh: 家庭应该比你的事业更重要。

en: We should have some interests outside our job.
zh: 我们应该在工作之外培养一些兴趣。

en: Don't play on the job.
zh: 不要在工作时间玩耍。

en: Aside from his work, he has no other interests.
zh: 除了工作，他没有其他爱好。

en: We went all out to get the job done.
zh: 我们全力以赴地完成了这项工作。

en: Don't leave your work half done.
zh: 不要把工作做到一半就 छोड़下。

en: I'm looking for a job.
zh: 我在找工作。

en: Don't leave your work half finished.
zh: 不要把工作半途而废。

en: Don't neglect your business.
zh: 不要荒废你的事业。

en: I need your approval before I leave work early.
zh: 我需要你的批准才能提早下班。

en: He began to look for a job.
zh: 他开始找工作了。

en: You cannot be too careful when you choose your job.
zh: 选择工作时，再小心也不为过。

en: Did you accomplish the task?
zh: 你完成任务了吗？

en: Having finished my work, I left the office.
zh: 完成工作后，我离开了办公室。

en: Having finished my work, I went home.
zh: 完成工作后，我回家了。

en: After they had finished their work, they went out.
zh: 他们完成工作后，就出去了。

en: After I had finished the job, I went to bed.
zh: 完成工作后，我就睡觉了。

en: Having finished the work, I went out for a walk.
zh: 完成工作后，我出去散步了。

en: Having finished the work, he went to bed.
zh: 完成工作后，他就睡觉了。

en: After we finished working, we enjoyed talking together.
zh: 我们完成工作后，一起愉快地聊天。

en: When I get through with my work, I'll call you.
zh: 等我做完工作，我会给你打电话。

en: You may leave when you have finished the work.
zh: 你完成工作后就可以离开了。

en: I can fall back on my savings if I lose my job.
zh: 如果我失业了，我可以动用我的存款。

en: If you quit your job, you'll be burning your bridges.
zh: 如果你辞职，就等于自断后路。

en: Bring your work to my room.
zh: 把你的工作拿到我的房间来。

en: Let us start our week.
zh: 让我们开始我们的一周吧。

en: Have you got through with your work?
zh: 你完成你的工作了吗？

en: A few minutes after he finished his work, he went to bed.
zh: 他完成工作几分钟后，就睡觉了。

en: I'll come over after I finish the work.
zh: 我做完工作就过来。

en: Can you get the work finished in time?
zh: 你能按时完成工作吗？

en: He worked all night so that he could get the job done in time.
zh: 他工作了一整夜，这样他才能及时完成工作。

en: There are some people who enjoy work - in fact, they love to work.
zh: 有些人喜欢工作——事实上，他们热爱工作。

en: Figuring a way to make a dollar comes ahead of thinking about how to do the job better.
zh: 想办法挣钱比考虑如何把工作做得更好更重要。

en: I've accomplished my task.
zh: 我已经完成了我的任务。

en: It's time to leave off work.
zh: 该停止工作了。

en: Are you going to quit your job?
zh: 你要辞职吗？

en: Let's stop working and relax for a while.
zh: 我们停止工作，放松一会儿吧。

en: If you quit the job, you'll be burning your bridges.
zh: 如果你辞职，你将会自断后路。

en: We have almost finished our work.
zh: 我们几乎完成了我们的工作。

en: Go ahead with your work.
zh: 继续你的工作吧。

en: Let's press on with our work.
zh: 让我们继续努力工作吧。

en: Carry out the task as well as you can.
zh: 尽你所能地完成任务。

en: I wish I didn't have to work.
zh: 我真希望我不用工作。

en: When you're at work, if you have a lot of workmates, it's surprisingly difficult to build a consensus.
zh: 当你在工作时，如果你有很多同事，达成共识出奇地困难。

en: I don't feel like working; what about going to a cinema instead?
zh: 我不想工作；不如去看电影怎么样？

en: I don't feel like working. How about going to a movie instead?
zh: 我不想工作。不如去看电影怎么样？

en: His work finished, he went to bed.
zh: 他完成了工作，就去睡觉了。

en: Don't interfere with my work.
zh: 不要妨碍我的工作。

en: Instead of being here to work, you get the sense that he's simply a permanent fixture here.
zh: 你感觉他不仅仅是来这里工作，而是像一个永久的摆设。

en: Are you working?
zh: 你在工作吗？

en: Having finished my work, I went out for a walk.
zh: 完成工作后，我出去散步了。

en: Having done his work, he went out.
zh: 他做完工作后，就出去了。

en: Not doing one's work properly may be worse than not doing it at all.
zh: 不好好完成工作可能比根本不做更糟糕。

en: People that want to do well in their jobs will dress for success.
zh: 想把工作做好的人会注重穿着打扮。

en: What with my business and private affairs, I am so busy.
zh: 由于我的生意和私事，我非常忙。

en: Work is not the object of life any more than play is.
zh: 工作和玩乐一样，都不是人生的唯一目的。

en: Almost all the work is done now.
zh: 现在几乎所有的工作都完成了。

en: On my way to work, I ran into my uncle.
zh: 在上班的路上，我碰到了我的叔叔。

en: I also know the job won't be very well done.
zh: 我也知道这项工作不会做得很好。

en: The work should let up by a week from today.
zh: 工作应该在从今天起一周内轻松下来。

en: Work is behind schedule.
zh: 工作进度落后了。

en: The work is marching right along.
zh: 工作进展顺利。

en: His work absorbed all his energies.
zh: 他的工作占据了他所有的精力。

en: I've done half the work, and now I can take a break.
zh: 我已经完成了一半的工作，现在我可以休息一下了。

en: The work will be finished by 8 o'clock.
zh: 工作将在八点钟完成。

en: How's work?
zh: 工作怎么样？

en: Don't leave your work unfinished.
zh: 不要留下未完成的工作。

en: The work is progressing steadily.
zh: 工作进展顺利。

en: The job is a lot of fun.
zh: 这份工作很有趣。

en: Is it difficult work?
zh: 这是困难的工作吗？

en: My job is dull and boring.
zh: 我的工作枯燥乏味。

en: Let's finish the work quickly and enjoy ourselves.
zh: 让我们快速完成工作，好好享受一下。

en: Do your work quickly.
zh: 快点做你的工作。

en: How are you getting along with your work?
zh: 你的工作进展如何？

en: The work was carried on steadily.
zh: 工作一直在稳步进行。

en: I am through with my work.
zh: 我的工作完成了。

en: I have finished my work.
zh: 我已经完成了我的工作。

en: The work wasn't finished at 11:00 p.m. Friday, so they decided to carry it over to the following Monday.
zh: 星期五晚上11点工作还没有完成，所以他们决定把它推迟到下周一。

en: My job is easy and I have a lot of free time.

en: The trick worked beautifully.

en: Craft must have clothes, but truth loves to go naked.
zh: 工艺需要装饰，但真理喜欢赤裸。

en: It was raining last night.

en: I could not sleep much last night.
